meanings.definition: To fly or rise higher than
meanings.sent1: The eagle outsoars all other birds in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The hot air balloon outsoars the trees as it floats above them.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's ability to outsoar any obstacle makes for an entertaining movie plot.
meanings.sent4: Her ambition to outsoar her limitations led her to great success.
meanings.sent5: The rocket outsoars into space, leaving a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.definition: To surpass in height or achievement
meanings.sent1: His determination to outsoar his previous record was evident in his training.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper outsoars all other buildings in the city.
meanings.sent3: The student's grades outsoar those of his classmates, earning him the top spot.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork outsoars any other in the gallery, attracting many admirers.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's performance outsoars expectations, winning him the championship.
